summary: Over 20 U.S. agencies provide foreign assistance for activities ranging from promoting democracy and better health to building the capacity of local security forces. We looked at 52 strategies used by the 6 agencies that provide most foreign assistance and found they had well-defined goals. However, they did not always address how agencies will cooperate and measure progress toward those goals. Also, the strategies’ relationships...
title: Foreign Assistance: Better Guidance for Strategy Development Could Help Agencies Align Their Efforts
